name: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Community Corrections

Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Co: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Community Corrections The Certificate of Undergraduate Study (CUGS) in Community Corrections provides a sequence of courses emphasizing the core of evidence-based practices in the field of community corrections and risk reduction/behavior change (such as Offender reentry and reintegration, parole and probation, treatment of the offender, and drugs and crime in America). The course selections are designed to help students seeking careers in criminal justice to be more competitive in the rapidly expanding area of community corrections.

Total Required Credits for the Program: 15 s.h. To be awarded the CUGS in Community Corrections, students must complete all courses required for the CUGS in Community Corrections with at least a 2.0 average.
